verses.text: For the end. Destroy not: by David for a memorial, when Saul sent, and watched his house to kill him.
Deliver me from mine enemies, O God; and ransom me from those that rise up against me.
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
For, behold, they have hunted after my soul; violent men have set upon me: neither \add is it\add* my iniquity, nor my sin, O Lord.
Without iniquity I ran and directed \add my course aright\add*: awake to help me, and behold.
And thou, Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, draw nigh to visit all the heathen; pity not any that work iniquity. Pause.
They shall return at evening, and hunger like a dog, and go round about the city.
Behold, they shall utter a voice with their mouth, and a sword is in their lips; for who, \add say they\add*, has heard?
But thou, Lord, wilt laugh them to scorn; thou wilt utterly set at nought all the heathen.
I will keep my strength, \add looking\add* to thee; for thou, O God, art my helper.
\add As for\add* my God, his mercy shall go before me: my God will shew me \add vengeance\add* on mine enemies.
Slay them not, lest they forget thy \f + \fr 58:12 \ft some read λαοῦ 'people'.\f*law; scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord, my defender.
\add For\add* the sin of their mouth, \add and\add* the word of their lips, let them be even taken in their pride.

And for \add their\add* cursing and falsehood shall utter destruction be denounced: \add they shall fall\add* by the wrath of utter destruction, and shall not be; so shall they know that the God of Jacob is Lord of the ends of the earth. Pause.
They shall return at evening, and be hungry as a dog, and go round about the city.
They shall be scattered hither and thither for meat; and if they be not satisfied, they shall even murmur.
But I will sing to thy strength, and in the morning will I exult \add in\add* thy mercy; for thou hast been my supporter, and my refuge in the day of mine affliction.
\add Thou art\add* my helper; to thee, my God, will I sing; thou art my supporter, O my God, \add and\add* my mercy.
